snippet: Leila de Lima said that she was the victim of a campaign to end her inquiry into the president’s possible role in extrajudicial killings....
abstract: Philippine Sen Leila de Lima, chairwoman of Senate Justice Committee and prominent critic of Pres Rodrigo Duterte, is stripped of her post following allegations she had received payoffs from drug lords; de Lima, who was engaged in inquiry into Duterte's violent war on drugs, claims to be victim of 'new McCarthyism.'

byline.original: By RICHARD C. PADDOCK and FELIPE VILLAMOR

lead_paragraph: Leila de Lima said that she was the victim of a campaign to end her inquiry into the president’s possible role in extrajudicial killings.

headline.main: Ousted Critic of Rodrigo Duterte Decries ‘New McCarthyism’ in Philippines
headline.print_headline: Philippine Senator, Duterte Critic, Loses Major Post
